title: Refactoring to Patterns. Addison-Wesley Signature Series. In this book Joshua Kerievsky addresses the question of how patterns can be inserted into an OO system step by step. The book is a consequent continuation of Fowler

container-title: It focuses on refactoring to push the development of frameworks
title: Refactoring Object-Oriented Frameworks Ph.D. thesis, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. The first comprehensive work dealing with refactoring

note: This standard work on design patterns also contains patterns References and Further Reading 77
title: Design Patterns. Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software

note: JDepend analyzes the dependencies between packages and classes and calculates Robert Martin’s metrics (see Martin, 1997).
title: A depiction of the Tell, don’t ask principle
JDepend as an Eclipse plugin
Rechnernetze nach ISO-OSI, CCITT. Describes the ISO-OSI layer model
Large-Scale C++ Software Design. Addison-Wesley. This book introduces important architecture principles of comprehensive software systems that are relevant beyond the C++ context

note: The article depicts the Law of Demeter.
title: Assuring Good Style for Object-Oriented Programs

container-title: The original article about Mock Objects was introduced at the XP 2000 conference
title: Endo-Testing: Unit Testing with Mock Objects
Conference. The online version of this resource can be found at

container-title: Proceedings of the Sixth European Conference on Pattern Languages of Programming and Computing
title: Dependency Structures. Architectural Diagnoses and Therapies

note: Article about the Eclipse plugin model.
title: Notes on the Eclipse Plugin Architecture
Pattern Languages of Program Design. Addison-Wesley. Contains many important articles about software architectures and patterns

container-title: Pattern Languages of Program Design. Addison-Wesley
title: Lifecycle and refactoring patterns that support evolution and reuse
Patterns of Enterprise Application Architecture. Addison-Wesley. Contains many important design patterns for the programming of comprehensive business applications
Inversion of Control Containers and the Dependency Injection Pattern
Here, Fowler focuses on the inversion of control containers and discusses several approaches to the generation of plugins

container-title: Proceedings of the 4th International Conference on Extreme Programming and Agile Processes in Software Engineering, XP 2004
title: Inline method considered helpful: an approach to interface evolution

note: The design pattern bible. Also contains the facade pattern.
title: Design Patterns. Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software

container-title: Proceedings of XP 2004 International Conference on Extreme Programming and Agile Processes in Software Engineering. Springer, LNCS. This XP-2004 conference contribution elaborates on the problems of large refactorings in an 156 4 Large Refactorings
title: Towards a proper integration of large refactorings in agile software development

note: In this article, DIP (Dependency Inversion Principle) is also described.
title: Stability. C++ Report. Even though this contribution is several years old, its content has neither collected dust, nor is it C++-specific

note: personal ways of communication, approaches to communication improvement.
title: Miteinander reden
Volume Two of this bestselling series. How to develop a systemic view of mutual restraints and vicious circles in communication

container-title: Analogies between teams consisting of several persons and the inner team, the References and Further Reading 157
title: Miteinander reden
Volume Three of this bestselling series
This mailing list discusses database-related topics with a focus on agile methods
The process of database refactoring
An article that gives an overview of database refactorings, including descriptions of the development processes
Catalog of database refactorings
A catalogue of frequently used refactorings of database schemas
SQL for Smarties – Advanced SQL Programming
This book provides an introduction to advanced SQL concepts and presents suggestions for solutions for recurring modeling problems, such as the mapping of tree structures to relational databases
Evolutionary database design
This article explains the basic concepts of evolutionary database design. Refactorings of database schemas, the migration of data as well as refactorings of database access codes are examined

note: Presented at XP/Agile Universe 2002, www.xpuniverse.com. Here, among other issues, the deprecated marker of database elements is discussed.
title: The agile database: tutorial notes

container-title: In this book you will find – besides a number of very useful tips for Java programming
note: an instruction for realizing typesafe and expandable enumeration types (typesafe enums) in Java.
title: Effective Java. Addison-Wesley. Bloch argues that inheritance must be planned. If inheritance from a class has not explicitly been provided for, it should rather be prevented (for example through setting the class to final
Refactoring: Improving the Design of Existing Code. Addison-Wesley. Not only does Fowler describe basic refactorings here, he also introduces the distinction between public and published interfaces

note: Among them are patterns that simplify evolution between subsystems, such as, for example, the Adaptable mechanism.
title: Contributing to Eclipse – Principles, Patterns, Plug-ins. Addison-Wesley, Eclipse Series. In this standard work about plugin development with Eclipse the authors depict very diverse mechanisms realized in the Eclipse framework
The Java Language Specification. Addison-Wesley. A language specification for Java

note: Here, tools for the handling of refactoring tags as well as implementation methods for these tools are presented. Also discusses how much help converters can provide for migration.
publisher: Software Engineering Group, Dept. of Informatics, University of Hamburg
title: Werkzeuge für die Migrationsunterstützung von Anwendungen auf neue Rahmenwerksversionen
Refactoring tags for automatic refactoring of framework
This article is the first one to introduce the concept of refactoring tags

note: Describes work with the deprecated tag.
title: How and When to Deprecate APIs. Part of the Java2 Documentation

container-title: 2001 Extreme Programming Examined. Addison-Wesley. Conference publication of the XP-2000 Conference
note: Illustrates various experiences in the use of XP techniques (such as refactoring) for frameworks.
title: JWAM and XP – using XP for framework development

note: Just like with using the deprecated tag in Java, the compiler will generate warnings for obsolete elements. References and Further Reading 247
title: Eiffel: The Language. Prentice-Hall. Meyer introduces the reader to the language Eiffel, which offers an option for marking classes and methods as deprecated with the keyword obsolete

note: To support the integration process, a tool-based solution for the recognition of such conflicts is introduced as an example: the Java Migration Browser JaMB.
title: Weiterentwicklung objektorientierter Softwaresysteme: Risiken und deren Vermeidung

Springer-Verlag. This work provides an overview of important migration conflicts in literature and practice, which are further scrutinized using Java. The focus is on conflict scenarios that can emerge during the integration of more complex subsystem versions

note: The focus is only on binary compatibility, not on source code compatibility though.
title: Evolving Java-based APIs
Depicts possible API changes and their compatibilities

container-title: Conference publication of the XP-2000 Conference
note: Analyses of problems related to API changes and some ideas for solutions.
title: : eXtreme frameworking – how to aim applications at evolving frameworks
Extreme Programming Examined. Addison-Wesley
Component Software. Addison-Wesley. Standard work about components that also offers insights on some of the aspects discussed here
